Chapter III  

“Pyotr Petrovitch!” she shouted, “help me… you have to! Make this crazy woman realize she can’t treat a lady in trouble like this… there’s a law for that! I’ll go straight to the governor-general if I have to… she’ll pay for this… Remember my dad’s kindness and protect these orphans.”  

“Please, madam… let me through.” Pyotr Petrovitch waved her off. “As you know, I didn’t have the honor of knowing your father” (someone snickered). “I’m not here to get involved in your endless fights with Amalia Ivanovna. I’ve come to discuss my own matters… and I need to speak with your stepdaughter, Sofya… Ivanovna, right? Excuse me.”  

Pyotr Petrovitch squeezed past her and headed to the corner where Sonia was.  

Katerina Ivanovna stood frozen, shocked. She couldn’t believe Pyotr Petrovitch would deny ever having enjoyed her father’s hospitality. Even though she made it up herself, she was convinced it was true by now. She was also taken aback by Pyotr Petrovitch’s cold, business-like, and even dismissive tone. The noise around them faded as he walked in. Not only did this “serious businessman” seem totally out of place among the rest, but it was clear…

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Katerina Ivanovna is bewildered by Pyotr Petrovitch's dismissive attitude towards her and her family's misfortunes.
